from AlDRayoqapu as syn. with AlDRayoqu; (S;) and as AA relates the verse, it is [thus] with kesr to the p in bDyqp; the word not being made the [proper] name of a place, but the meaning being bDyqp maA bayona Alnjm wAldbrAn [i. e. in the narrow space between the Pleiades and Ed-Debarán]. (TA.)
DayoqapN is also the fem. of DayoqN the contracted form of DayRiqN. (S, O, TA.)
DiyqapN: see the next preceding paragraph, former half, in two places.

DuwqaI and DiyqaI are fems. of OaDoyaqu↓; (S, O, K;) the former [as well as the latter] is [originally] of the measure fuEolaI, (TA,) [each being originally DuyoqaI,] the I being changed in the former into w because quiescent and preceded by dammeh: (S, O, TA:) the former occurs in the saying of a woman to her fellowwife, contending with her for superiority,

L.foreign: maA Oanoti biAlxuwraI walaA AlDRuwqaI HirFA

sense.s: [Thou art not the better nor the narrower &c.; xuwraI being in like manner fem. of Oaxoyaru]. (TA.) Accord. to Kr, the former is pl. of DayRiqapN↓; (TA;) and he says the same of DiyqaI also; (TA voce kayRisN;) but ISd says, I know not how this may be, for fuEolaI is not of the measures of pls. except of the kind of pl. which differs not from its sing. otherwise than in the latter's having p [as an affix], like buhomaApN and buhomaI [q. v.]. (TA in the present art.)
DiyaAqN: see miDoyaAqN.
DaAYiqN: see the next paragraph, in four places.

DayRiqN and DayoqN↓, (S, O, K,) the latter a contraction of the former, (S,) the two being like hayRinN and hayonN [&c.], (O,) and DaAYiqN↓, (K,) Narrow, or strait: (S, * O, * K:) or DayRiqN is an epithet used in this sense when permanence [of the attribute] is meant [and so therefore is its contracted form]; and DaAYiqN↓ as meaning [being, or becoming, narrow or strait; or] temporarily narrow or strait: (Msb:) the fem. of the first (TA) and of the second (S, O, TA) [as well as of the third] is with p: (S, O, TA:) see also DuwqaI: [the pls. of the first and second, applied to rational beings, is DayRiquwna and Dayoquwna, like mayRituwna and mayotuwna: and] the pl. of DaAYiqN↓ is DaAqapF. (TA.) You say XaIoCN DayRiqN (O, Msb) and DayoqN↓ (O) A narrow, or strait, thing. (O, * Msb.) And SadorN DayRiqN (assumed tropical:) A strait, or contracted, mind; (Msb;) and nafosN DayRiqapN [meaning the same]. (TA.) And bihi Sadoruka waDaAYqN↓, in the Kur [xi. 15], means (assumed tropical:) And thy mind is temporarily strait or contracted thereby. (Msb.) DayRiqN signifies also (assumed tropical:) Niggardly, or avaricious. (KL.) [And DayRiqu Alxuluqi (assumed tropical:) Narrow, or illiberal, in disposition.]
OaDoyaqu [More, and most, narrow or strait or contracted]: (S, O, K:) see its fems. DuwqaI and DiyqaI, above. [See also three exs. voce AisotN, in art. sth.]

maDiyqN A narrow, or strait, place: (K:) [a pass: a place of narrowness or straitness] of land; and of the vulva; and (assumed tropical:) [a place, or state, of straitness] of life, or of the means of subsistence: (K in art. Azm:) and (tropical:) a narrow, or strait, affair or case: (K, TA:) pl. maDaAyiqu. (TA.)
OamorN muDayRaqN (assumed tropical:) [An affair rendered strait]. (TA.)

miDoyaAqN, (JK, and O on the authority of Ibn- 'Abbád, and TA,) or DiyaAqN↓, like kitaAbN [in measure], thus in all the copies of the K, (TA,) [but probably, I think, taken from a mistranscription,] A pessary (durojapN) of rag and perfume, with which a woman endeavours to constrict her vagina (tasotaDiyqu bihaA). (JK, Ibn-'Abbád, O, K.)

4. OaDoyalati AlOaroDu OaDaAlat The land had in it [trees of the species called] DaAl: (Fr, S, O:) or ADAl AlmakaAnu and OaDoyala the place gave growth to DAl: (AHn, M, K:) or had in it many DAl. (IKtt, TA.)

DaAlN The wild [species of lote-tree called] sidor [q. v.]: (S, O, K:) or such of the sidor as are watered only by the rain; (M, K:) the sidor of the mountains, which is thinner in its wood than that of the rivers: AHn says, it grows in the plain, or soft, tracts, and in the rugged; and the bow that is made of it, when it is pared, is pared so as to be thick, in order that it may be stronger, because of the lightness of its wood: (M:) n. un. with p. (S, M, O, K.) [See also EuboriIRN, and EumoriIRN.]

Also Another species of tree; (M, K;) AHn says, it is a tree of the shrub-kind, found in the borders of El-Yemen, rising to the height of a cubit, in its manner of growth like the cypress, and having a yellow [fruit of the sort called a] baramap, of a very pungent odour, so that its odour comes to you before you reach it: it is not of the sidor thus called. (M.)
DaAlapN n. un. of DaAlN [q. v.]. (S, M, O, K.)

Also Arrows, (M, O, TA,) and bows, (TA,) made of the [species of lote-tree called] DaAl: (M, TA:) this is the primary signification: (TA:) or arrows, (IB, K,) because they are made thereof: (IB:) or it signifies, (K,) or signifies also, (O,) all kinds of weapons. (O, K.) One says, raOayotuhu yaromiI biAlDRaAlapi [I saw him shooting arrows]. (TA.) And xaraja wafiI yadihi DaAlapN i. e. [He went forth having in his hand] a bow. (TA.) And UinRahu lakaAmilu AlDRaAlapi Verily he is complete in respect of weapons. (O.) And xaraja fulaAnN biDaAlatihi Such a one went forth with his weapons. (O.)

1. DaAmahu, (S, Msb,) aor. yaDiymuhu, (S,) inf. n. DayomN, (S, * Msb,) [as also DaAmahu, aor. yaDuwmuhu, inf. n. DawoN, (see art. Dwm,)] He wronged him; treated him wrongfully, unjustly, injuriously, or tyrannically: (S:) he harmed, injured, hurt, or damaged, him: (Msb:) and AstDAmhu↓ signifies the same. (S.) And DaAmahu HaqRahu, (M, K,) aor. as above, (K,) and so the inf. n., (M,) He defrauded him of his right, or due, partially or wholly; (M, K;) as also AstDAmhu↓. (K.)

And Dumotu I was wronged, &c.: of which there are three dial. vars.; one says of a man Diyma; and Duyoma, with [the pronunciation termed] UiXomaAm; and Duwma; like as we have said respecting biyEa. (S.) One says, maA Dimotu OaHadF wamaA Dumotu [I have not wronged any one, and I have not been wronged]; i. e. no one has wronged me. (TA.) It is said in a trad., as some relate it, laA tuDaAmuwna fiI ruWoyatihi [or tuDaAmRuwna↓ or taDaAmRuwna↓ Ye will not be wronged in the seeing Him]. (M. [For other readings and explanations of this trad., see 3 in art. Dr.])
3: and 6: see the preceding paragraph.
10: see 1, in two places.
DayomN Wrong; i. e. wrongdoing; or wrongful, unjust, injurious, or tyrannical, treatment: (S, K:) an inf. n. which is pluralized; its pl. being DuyuwmN. (M, K.)
DiymN The side of a mountain, (S, M, K,) and of an [eminence such as is termed] Oakamap. (M.)

DaAYimN Wronging, or a wrongdoer: pl. DaAmapN: the latter occurring in the prov., taOotiI bika AlDRaAmapu EirRiysa AlOasadi [The wrongdoers bring thee, or cause thee to come, to the covert of the lion]; meaning, the wrong of the wrongdoers requires thee to cast thyself into destruction: applied in offering an excuse for venturing upon that which is perilous: or, as some relate it, AlDRaAmRapu, from AlDRamRu; meaning “ want, or the object of want, that brings thee and causes thee to have recourse [to a thing]. ” (Meyd.)
maDiymN Wronged; treated wrongfully, unjustly, injuriously, or tyrannically: as also musotaDaAmN↓. (S, K, * TA.)
musotaDaAmN: see what next precedes.
